member.name: M:Algolia.Search.AlgoliaClient.AddUserKeyAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Create a new user key.
member.param: The list of ACL for this key. Defined by an array of strings that can contains the following values: - search: allow searching (https and http) - addObject: allow adding/updating an object in the index (https only) - deleteObject : allow deleting an existing object (https only) - deleteIndex : allow deleting an index (https only) - settings : allow getting index settings (https only) - editSettings : allow changing index settings (https only)
The number of seconds after which the key will be automatically removed (0 means no time limit for this key).
Specify the maximum number of API calls allowed from an IP address per hour. Defaults to 0 (no rate limit).
Specify the maximum number of hits this API key can retrieve in one call. Defaults to 0 (unlimited).
Restrict the new API key to specific index names.
member.returns: Returns an object with a "key" string attribute containing the new key.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.AlgoliaClient.AddUserKey(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})

member.param: The list of ACL for this key. The number of seconds after which the key will be automatically removed (0 means no time limit for this key).
Specify the maximum number of API calls allowed from an IP address per hour. Defaults to 0 (no rate limit).
Specify the maximum number of hits this API key can retrieve in one call. Defaults to 0 (unlimited).
Restrict the new API key to specific index names.
member.returns: Returns an object with a "key" string attribute containing the new key.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Index.SetSettingsAsync(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Set the settings for this index.
member.param: The settings object can contain: - minWordSizefor1Typo: (integer) the minimum number of characters to accept one typo (default = 3). - minWordSizefor2Typos: (integer) the minimum number of characters to accept two typos (default = 7). - hitsPerPage: (integer) the number of hits per page (default = 10). - attributesToRetrieve: (array of strings) default list of attributes to retrieve in objects. If set to null, all attributes are retrieved. - attributesToHighlight: (array of strings) default list of attributes to highlight. If set to null, all indexed attributes are highlighted. - attributesToSnippet**: (array of strings) default list of attributes to snippet alongside the number of words to return (syntax is attributeName:nbWords). By default no snippet is computed. If set to null, no snippet is computed. - searchableAttributes(formerly attributesToIndex): (array of strings) the list of fields you want to index. If set to null, all textual and numerical attributes of your objects are indexed, but you should update it to get optimal results. This parameter has two important uses: - Limit the attributes to index: For example if you store a binary image in base64, you want to store it and be able to retrieve it but you don't want to search in the base64 string. - Control part of the ranking*: (see the ranking parameter for full explanation) Matches in attributes at the beginning of the list will be considered more important than matches in attributes further down the list. In one attribute, matching text at the beginning of the attribute will be considered more important than text after, you can disable this behavior if you add your attribute inside `unordered(AttributeName)`, for example searchableAttributes: ["title", "unordered(text)"]. - attributesForFaceting: (array of strings) The list of fields you want to use for faceting. All strings in the attribute selected for faceting are extracted and added as a facet. If set to null, no attribute is used for faceting. - ranking: (array of strings) controls the way results are sorted. We have six available criteria: - typo: sort according to number of typos, - geo: sort according to decreassing distance when performing a geo-location based search, - proximity: sort according to the proximity of query words in hits, - attribute: sort according to the order of attributes defined by searchableAttributes, - exact: sort according to the number of words that are matched identical to query word (and not as a prefix), - custom: sort according to a user defined formula set in **customRanking** attribute. The standard order is ["typo", "geo", "proximity", "attribute", "exact", "custom"] - customRanking: (array of strings) lets you specify part of the ranking. The syntax of this condition is an array of strings containing attributes prefixed by asc (ascending order) or desc (descending order) operator. For example `"customRanking" => ["desc(population)", "asc(name)"]` - queryType: Select how the query words are interpreted, it can be one of the following value: - prefixAll: all query words are interpreted as prefixes, - prefixLast: only the last word is interpreted as a prefix (default behavior), - prefixNone: no query word is interpreted as a prefix. This option is not recommended. - highlightPreTag: (string) Specify the string that is inserted before the highlighted parts in the query result (default to ""). - highlightPostTag: (string) Specify the string that is inserted after the highlighted parts in the query result (default to ""). - optionalWords: (array of strings) Specify a list of words that should be considered as optional when found in the query.
Forward the operation to the replica indices

member.summary: Synchronously call .

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Index.AddUserKey(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Synchronously call .

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Index.AddUserKeyAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new user key associated with this index.
member.param: The list of ACL for this key. Defined by an array of strings that can contains the following values: - search: allow searching (https and http) - addObject: allow adding/updating an object in the index (https only) - deleteObject : allow deleting an existing object (https only) - deleteIndex : allow deleting an index (https only) - settings : allow getting index settings (https only) - editSettings : allow changing index settings (https only)
The number of seconds after which the key will be automatically removed (0 means no time limit for this key).
Specify the maximum number of API calls allowed from an IP address per hour. Defaults to 0 (no rate limit).
Specify the maximum number of hits this API key can retrieve in one call. Defaults to 0 (unlimited).
member.returns: Returns an object with a "key" string attribute containing the new key.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Index.AddUserKey(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.summary: Update a user key associated to this index.
member.param: The user key

The list of ACL for this key. Defined by an array of strings that can contains the following values: - search: allow searching (https and http) - addObject: allow adding/updating an object in the index (https only) - deleteObject : allow deleting an existing object (https only) - deleteIndex : allow deleting an index (https only) - settings : allow getting index settings (https only) - editSettings : allow changing index settings (https only)
The number of seconds after which the key will be automatically removed (0 means no time limit for this key).
Specify the maximum number of API calls allowed from an IP address per hour. Defaults to 0 (no rate limit).
Specify the maximum number of hits this API key can retrieve in one call. Defaults to 0 (unlimited).
member.returns: Returns an object with a "key" string attribute containing the new key.

The array of disjunctive facets.

member.name: T:Algolia.Search.IndexHelper`1

The name of the Algolia index.
The name of the field to use for mapping to the Algolia objectID.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.IndexHelper`1.OverwriteIndexAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Indexes all objects using a temporary index that is then atomically moved to the destination index. All previous content will be overwritten. You must supply all objects to this method that need to exist within the index.
member.param: An enumerable list of objects to override the index with.
Maximum number of objects per indexing call. Should be between 1,000 and 10,000 depending on size of objects.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.IndexHelper`1.OverwriteIndex(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Indexes all objects using a temporary index that is then atomically moved to the destination index. All previous content will be overwritten. You must supply all objects to this method that need to exist within the index.
member.param: An enumerable list of objects to override the index with.
Maximum number of objects per indexing call. Should be between 1,000 and 10,000 depending on size of objects.

member.param: An enumerable list of objects to add or update.

member.returns: An array of objects containing an "objectIDs" attribute (array of string).

member.returns: An array of objects containing an "objectIDs" attribute (array of string).

The query.

member.summary: Create a new index query.

member.name: T:Algolia.Search.Query
member.summary: Builder of queries.

member.name: T:Algolia.Search.Query.QueryType
member.summary: The type of query.

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.QueryType.PREFIX_ALL
member.summary: All query words are interpreted as prefixes.

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.QueryType.PREFIX_LAST
member.summary: Only the last word is interpreted as a prefix (default behavior).

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.QueryType.PREFIX_NONE
member.summary: No query word is interpreted as a prefix. This option is not recommended.

member.name: T:Algolia.Search.Query.RemoveWordsIfNoResult
member.summary: Remove words if no result.

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.RemoveWordsIfNoResult.NONE
member.summary: No specific processing is done when a query does not return any result.

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.RemoveWordsIfNoResult.LAST_WORDS
member.summary: When a query does not return any result, the final word will be removed until there is results.

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.RemoveWordsIfNoResult.FIRST_WORDS
member.summary: When a query does not return any result, the first word will be removed until there is results.

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.RemoveWordsIfNoResult.ALL_OPTIONAL
member.summary: When a query does not return any result, a second trial will be made with all words as optional (which is equivalent to transforming the AND operand between query terms in a OR operand)

member.name: T:Algolia.Search.Query.TypoTolerance
member.summary: Typo tolerance.

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.TypoTolerance.TYPO_TRUE
member.summary: the typo-tolerance is enabled and all matching hits are retrieved. (Default behavior)

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.TypoTolerance.TYPO_FALSE
member.summary: the typo-tolerance is disabled.

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.TypoTolerance.TYPO_MIN
member.summary: only keep the results with the minimum number of typos.

member.name: F:Algolia.Search.Query.TypoTolerance.TYPO_STRICT
member.summary: hits matching with 2 typos are not retrieved if there are some matching without typos.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new query.
member.param: The query.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new query.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.clone
member.summary: Clone this query to a new query.
member.returns: The cloned query.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetQueryType(Algolia.Search.Query.QueryType)
member.summary: Select how the query words are interpreted.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetRemoveWordsIfNoResult(Algolia.Search.Query.RemoveWordsIfNoResult)
member.summary: Select the spcific processing for the query.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetQueryString(System.String)
member.summary: Set the full text query.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetSimilarQueryString(System.String)
member.summary: Set the full text similar query.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetMinProximity(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Configure the precision of the proximity ranking criterion. By default, the minimum (and best) proximity value distance between 2 matching words is 1. Setting it to 2 (or 3) would allow 1 (or 2) words to be found between the matching words without degrading the proximity ranking value.
Considering the query "javascript framework", if you set minProximity=2 the records "JavaScript framework" and "JavaScript charting framework" will get the same proximity score, even if the second one contains a word between the 2 matching words. Default to 1.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetHighlightingTags(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Specify the string that is inserted before/after the highlighted parts in the query result (default to "" / "").

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetSnippetEllipsisText(System.String)
member.summary: Specify the string that is used as an ellipsis indicator when a snippet is truncated (defaults to the empty string).

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetAttributesToRetrieve(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Specify the list of attribute names to retrieve.
member.param: The attributes to retrieve.
member.returns: Query for the attributes.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.DisableTypoToleranceOnAttributes(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: List of attributes on which you want to disable typo tolerance (must be a subset of the searchableAttributes index setting).
member.param: The list of attributes.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetAttributesToHighlight(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Specify the list of attribute names to highlight.
member.param: The attributes to highlight.
member.returns: Query for the attributes.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetAttributesToSnippet(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Specify the list of attribute names to Snippet alongside the number of words to return (syntax is 'attributeName:nbWords'). By default no snippet is computed.
member.param: The attributes to Snippet.
member.returns: Query for the attributes.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetFieldsToRetrieve(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Choose which fields the response will contain
member.param: Fields to retrieve
member.returns: Query for the attributes.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetMinWordSizeToAllowOneTypo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specify the minimum number of characters in a query word to accept one typo in this word. Defaults to 3.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetMinWordSizeToAllowTwoTypos(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specify the minimum number of characters in a query word to accept two typos in this word. Defaults to 7.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.GetRankingInfo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set, the result hits will contain ranking information in _rankingInfo attribute.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.IgnorePlural(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true, plural won't be considered as a typo (for example car/cars will be considered as equals). Defaults to false.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.IgnorePlural(Algolia.Search.Models.IIgnorePlurals)
member.summary: ignorePlural accept a comma separated string of languages "af,ar,az"

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableDistinct(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This feature is similar to the SQL "distinct" keyword: when enabled in a query with the distinct=1 parameter, all hits containing a duplicate value for the attributeForDistinct attribute are removed from results. For example, if the chosen attribute is show_name and several hits have the same value for show_name, then only the best one is kept and others are removed.
member.param: If set to true, enable the distinct feature (disabled by default) if the attributeForDistinct index setting is set.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableFacetingAfterDistinct(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Force faceting to be applied after de-duplication, When using the distinct setting in combination with faceting, facet counts may be higher than expected. This is because the engine computes faceting before applying de-duplication (distinct) https://www.algolia.com/doc/rest-api/search/#facetingafterdistinct
member.param: If set to true, enable the facetingAfterDistinct feature (disabled by default)

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableAnalytics(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to false, this query will not be taken into account in analytics feature. Default to true.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetAnalyticsTags(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Tag the query with the specified identifiers

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableSynonyms(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to false, this query will not use synonyms defined in configuration. Default to true.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableReplaceSynonymsInHighlight(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to false, words matched via synonyms expansion will not be replaced by the matched synonym in highlight result. Default to true.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableTypoTolerance(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to false, disable typo-tolerance. Default to true.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetTypoTolerance(Algolia.Search.Query.TypoTolerance)
member.summary: This option allows you to control the number of typos in the result set.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableTyposOnNumericTokens(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to false, disable typo-tolerance on numeric tokens. Default to true.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the page to retrieve (zero base). Defaults to 0.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetNbHitsPerPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the number of hits per page. Defaults to 10.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetOffset(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Set the offset for the pagination.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetLength(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Set the length for the pagination.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.ExactOnSingleWordQuery(System.String)
member.summary: Set the the parameter that controls how the `exact` ranking criterion is computed when the query contains one word

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.AlternativesAsExact(System.String)
member.summary: Specify the list of approximation that should be considered as an exact match in the ranking formula

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.AroundLatitudeLongitude(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Search for entries around a given latitude/longitude with an automatic guessing of the radius depending of the area density Note: at indexing, geoloc of an object should be set with _geoloc attribute containing lat and lng attributes (for example {"_geoloc":{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800}})
member.param: The latitude
The longitude

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.AroundLatitudeLongitude(System.Single,System.Single,Algolia.Search.Models.IAllRadius)
member.summary: Search for entries around a given latitude/longitude. Note: at indexing, geoloc of an object should be set with _geoloc attribute containing lat and lng attributes (for example {"_geoloc":{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800}})
member.param: The latitude
The longitude
set the maximum distance in meters.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.AroundLatitudeLongitude(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: (BACKWARD COMPATIBILITY)Search for entries around a given latitude/longitude. Note: at indexing, geoloc of an object should be set with _geoloc attribute containing lat and lng attributes (for example {"_geoloc":{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800}})
member.param: The latitude
The longitude
set the maximum distance in meters.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.AroundLatitudeLongitudeViaIP
member.summary: Search for entries around a given latitude/longitude (using IP geolocation) with an automatic radius depending of the density of the area Note: at indexing, geoloc of an object should be set with _geoloc attribute containing lat and lng attributes (for example {"_geoloc":{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800}})
member.param: set the maximum distance in meters.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.AroundLatitudeLongitude(System.Single,System.Single,Algolia.Search.Models.IAllRadius,System.Int32)
member.summary: Search for entries around a given latitude/longitude. Note: at indexing, geoloc of an object should be set with _geoloc attribute containing lat and lng attributes (for example {"_geoloc":{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800}})
member.param: The latitude
The longitude
set the maximum distance in meters.
set the precision for ranking (for example if you set precision=100, two objects that are distant of less than 100m will be considered as identical for "geo" ranking parameter).

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.AroundLatitudeLongitude(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: (BACKWARD COMPATIBILITY)Search for entries around a given latitude/longitude. Note: at indexing, geoloc of an object should be set with _geoloc attribute containing lat and lng attributes (for example {"_geoloc":{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800}})
member.param: The latitude
The longitude
set the maximum distance in meters.
set the precision for ranking (for example if you set precision=100, two objects that are distant of less than 100m will be considered as identical for "geo" ranking parameter).

member.summary: Search for entries around a given latitude/longitude (using IP geolocation). Note: at indexing, geoloc of an object should be set with _geoloc attribute containing lat and lng attributes (for example {"_geoloc":{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800}})
member.param: set the maximum distance in meters.

member.param: set the maximum distance in meters.

member.param: set the maximum distance in meters.
set the precision for ranking (for example if you set precision=100, two objects that are distant of less than 100m will be considered as identical for "geo" ranking parameter).

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.InsideBoundingBox(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Search for entries inside a given area defined by the two extreme points of a rectangle. At indexing, you should specify geoloc of an object with the _geoloc attribute (in the form "_geoloc":{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800} or "_geoloc":[{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800},{"lat":48.547456, "lng":2.972075}] if you have several geo-locations in your record).
You can use several bounding boxes (OR) by calling this method several times.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.AddInsidePolygon(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Add a point to the polygon of geo-search (requires a minimum of three points to define a valid polygon) At indexing, you should specify geoloc of an object with the _geoloc attribute (in the form "_geoloc":{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800} or "_geoloc":[{"lat":48.853409, "lng":2.348800},{"lat":48.547456, "lng":2.972075}] if you have several geo-locations in your record).

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetFilters(System.String)
member.summary: Filter the query with numeric, facet or/and tag filters. The syntax is a SQL like syntax, you can use the OR and AND keywords. The syntax for the underlying numeric, facet and tag filters is the same than in the other filters: available=1 AND (category:Book OR NOT category:Ebook) AND public

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetNumericFilters(System.String)
member.summary: Add a list of numeric filters separated by a comma. The syntax of one filter is `attributeName` followed by `operand` and `value`. Suported operand are <, <=, =, > and >= You can have multiple conditions on one attribute like for example `numerics=price>100,price<1000`

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetOptionalWords(System.String)
member.summary: Set the list of words that should be considered as optional when found in the query.
member.param: The list of optional words, comma separated.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetFacetFilters(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Filter the query by a list of facets.
member.param: Each facet is encoded as `attributeName:value`. For example: `["category:Book","author:John%20Doe"].

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetFacetFilters(System.String)
member.summary: Filter the query by a facet.
member.param: The facet is encoded as `attributeName:value`.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetFacetFilters(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JArray)
member.summary: Filter the query by a list of facets.
member.param: Each facet is encoded as `attributeName:value`. For example: `["category:Book","author:John%20Doe"].

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetMaxValuesPerFacets(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the max value per facet.
member.param: The number to limit it by.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.RestrictSearchableAttributes(System.String)
member.summary: List of attributes you want to use for textual search (must be a subset of the searchableAttributes index setting).
member.param: Attributes are separated with a comma (for example @"name,address"). You can also use a JSON string array encoding (for example encodeURIComponent("[\"name\",\"address\"]")). By default, all attributes specified in searchableAttributes settings are used to search.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableAdvancedSyntax(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows enabling of advanced syntax.
member.param: Turn it on or off

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableRemoveStopWords(Algolia.Search.Models.IEnabledRemoveStopWords)
member.summary: Allows enabling of stop words removal.
member.param: Turn it on or/off or providing a list of keywords

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.EnableRemoveStopWords(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows enabling of stop words removal.
member.param: Turn it on or/off or providing a list of keywords

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetReferers(System.String)
member.summary: Limit the search from a referer pattern. Only works on HTTPS
member.param: List of referers used to limit the search on a website.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetUserToken(System.String)
member.summary: Set the key used for the rate-limit
member.param: Identifier used for the rate-limit

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetRestrictIndices(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Restrict an API key to a list of indices

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetRestrictSources(System.String)
member.summary: Restrict an API key to a specific IPv4

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.SetFacets(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Set the object attributes that you want to use for faceting.
member.param: List of object attributes that you want to use for faceting. Only attributes that have been added in **attributesForFaceting** index setting can be used in this parameter. You can also use `*` to perform faceting on all attributes specified in **attributesForFaceting**.

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.AddCustomParameter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a custom query parameter
member.param: The name of the custom parameter
The associated value

member.name: M:Algolia.Search.Query.GetQueryString
member.summary: Get out the query as a string
